summary: This is an internal email chain from August 2019 discussing the coordination of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. It outlines plans for weekly situation reports covering victim interviews, digital and financial analysis, forfeiture, and public corruption. It references a disturbing allegation from a victim and coordination between FBI field offices and specialized units.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JE' and 'Epstein', he is the central subject of the high-profile investigation. A victim allegation about his conduct is mentioned.

persons.name: ASAC New York Field Office Criminal - Branch C
persons.context: The author of the main directive email, instructing the recipient to start a Sensitive Case Notification (SCN) and weekly reports.

persons.name: A/SC
persons.role: Assistant Special Agent in Charge or Supervisory Special Agent
persons.context: Briefing the Deputy Assistant Director (DAD) on the case.

persons.name: DAD
persons.context: Being briefed on the Epstein case by the A/SC.

connections.person1: ASAC New York Field Office Criminal - Branch C
connections.description: ASAC is directing the recipient to ensure M is comfortable with the investigation's tracking and to schedule a conference call with him.
The email references a victim's allegation that Epstein asked her opinion about putting heads of adult females on child bodies and masturbating to the image.

events.title: Investigation Coordination Directive
events.description: An FBI ASAC directs the start of a Sensitive Case Notification (SCN) and weekly situation reports for the Epstein investigation, covering multiple fronts including victim interviews and financial analysis.
personsInvolved: ASAC New York Field Office Criminal - Branch C

events.title: Planned Conference Call
events.description: A conference call is to be scheduled for the next day (August 2, 2019) to discuss the investigation, with a check on the inclusion of the CEOS/CEOU unit.

events.title: Search of Epstein's Island
events.description: Referenced as a 'significant event' that should be detailed in the investigation updates.

events.title: Victim Interview Reveals Disturbing Allegation
events.description: A victim interviewed the previous day alleged that Jeffrey Epstein asked her opinion about putting heads of adult females on child bodies and masturbating to the image.

keyFacts: The email reveals the FBI's structured, multi-front approach to the Epstein investigation in August 2019, including victim interviews, digital/financial analysis, forfeiture, and public corruption probes.
It references a specific, highly disturbing allegation from a victim: that Epstein asked her opinion about 'putting heads of adult females on child bodies and masturbating to the image.'

The communication indicates high-level oversight and coordination, with briefings to the Deputy Assistant Director (DAD) and efforts to involve specialized units like CEOS/CEOU (likely Child Exploitation and Obscenity Section/Unit).
The directive emphasizes the need for detailed weekly reports to ensure all investigative fronts are tracked, highlighting the case's complexity and high-profile nature.
